tasks.use_case_description: Learn about how to manage mental wellbeing when facing daily scenarios, including dealing with stress, maintaining positivity, coping with procrastination, etc.
tasks.task_inspiration: Based on common wellbeing topics covered by APA (https://www.nih.gov/health-information/your-healthiest-self-wellness-toolkits/emotional-wellness-toolkit/emotional-wellness-toolkit-more-resources) and NIH (https://www.nih.gov/health-information/your-healthiest-self-wellness-toolkits/emotional-wellness-toolkit/emotional-wellness-toolkit-more-resources)

tasks.use_case_description: Learn how to plan menus or diets from food selection to preparation based on nutritional needs or constraints.
tasks.task_inspiration: Based on materials from various disease-based organizations/foundations, professional dietitian organizations, and the US Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics eatright.org

tasks.use_case_description: Learn about U.S. tax forms and how to file them and determine when and how specific tax regulations and law provisions apply to individual or company statuses.
tasks.task_inspiration: Based on the [2024 annual congress report of the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS)](https://www.taxpayeradvocate.irs.gov/reports/2024-annual-report-to-congress/most-serious-problems/), tax literacy is one of the top 10 most serious problems facing taxpayers. The report referenced the 2024 [Tax Foundation's National Tax Literacy Poll](https://taxfoundation.org/research/all/federal/us-tax-literacy-poll-knowledge-perceptions/) which spelled out common concepts that taxpayers struggled with.
tasks.cq_format: single-select MCQs with 5 options and one correct answer

tasks.use_case_description: Learn about different types of credits and debts, how credit scoring works, and how to manage one's financial liabilities.
tasks.task_inspiration: Based on educational materials provided by the following sources: 1) CFPB Consumer Guides (https://www.consumerfinance.gov/consumer-tools/ and https://www.consumerfinance.gov/consumer-tools/educator-tools/your-money-your-goals/toolkit/); 2) Credit Bureau Consumer Education (Commercial Authority: Experian, Equifax, TransUnion); 3) National Foundation for Credit Counseling blog articles (https://www.nfcc.org/blog/)
tasks.cq_format: single-select MCQs with 5 options and one correct answer
